meaningMnemonic: You <radical>say</radical> you have an <radical>axe</radical> with a <radical>drop</radical> of blood on it. You hit someone with that axe and now they're going to <kanji>sue</kanji> you. That drop of blood on your axe is pretty incriminating, which is why they have enough of a case to sue you.
readingMnemonic: You want to <kanji>sue</kanji> them back so you clean the axe with some <reading>so</reading>ap (そ). "Your honor," you say in court, "I don't see any drops of blood, I countersue!"
